properties.name: Berlin
properties.description: Posted by FryguyBerlin is one of the cities of the world that has great historic importance. After World War II, the USSR placed a barrier in Germany. It was called the Berlin Wall. The sole purpose of it was to keep East Germany on the Communist side and West Germany on the Allies side. This went throughout the Cold War and many years after that. Fortunately, the Berlin Wall was broken down during President Ronald Reagan\'s reign, and Germany has been free from Communist control ever since.

properties.name: Empire State Building from Park
properties.description: Posted by FryguyMcCarren ParkThe Empire State Building is one of the most important buildings of trade and commerce in the United States. Ever since the destruction of the Twin Towers, many people have switched to doing commerce here. It is the tallest building in the U.S., and one of the tallest single buildings in the world.

properties.name: Gainesville, Florida
properties.description: Posted by FryguyGainesville is probably the most well-known city in central Florida. For many decades, it has been home to the Florida Gators. Before that, the school and team were located in Ocala, Florida, not to far away from Gainesville. The school did not get its new name until Neal "Bo Gator" Storter became the football team\'s first captain. The University of Florida has since been one the most prominent unversities in the world.

properties.name: Hiroshima
properties.description: Posted by FryguyNearing the end of WWII, the United States had a threat to destroy after Nazi Germany. That threat was Japan. Under their militaristic ruler, Tojo, the Japanese launched relentless attacks against the U.S. in Asia and the South Pacific. We were then forced to drop nuclear bombs on the cities of Nagasaki and Hiroshima. When the Japanese realized what damage they had caused, the surrendered and the war ended.

properties.name: Jerusalem, Israel
properties.description: Posted by FryguyJerusalem has long been one of the most famous cities in the world. In Israel, it has always been a city of history and diverse culture. Since the time of King David in the Bible, many events have happenet here. Not only is it the place where the king ruled Israel from, but Jesus did a lot of His teaching and miracles here.

properties.name: Pearl Harbor
properties.description: Posted by FryguyHawaiiIf Pearl Harbor had never existed, then the United States would not have entered WWII. On December 7, 1941, the Japanese air force bombed Pearl Harbor and killed over 2000 US Marine and Navy soldiers. Outraged by this, FDR and the United States government retaliated by entering the war. The Japanese eventually paid by the destruction of Nagasaki and Hiroshima; both cities were bombed by the US.

properties.name: Persian Gulf
properties.description: Posted by FryguyMiddle EastThe Persian Gulf has always seen war. When Iraqi troops invaded Kuwait in the early 1990s, the US quickly retaliated. Victory came very quickly for the US. The war lasted only two and a half months, the shortest war that the United States has ever fought in.

properties.name: RCA dome
properties.description: Posted by FryguyIndianapolisThe RCA Dome has been the homefield for the Indianapolis Colts for several years. Before Indianapolis, they were located in Baltimore, and they stayed there until 1983. The Colts played in this stadium for the last time this season, because the dome is being replaced by another located elsewhere in the city.

properties.name: RIchmond, VA
properties.description: Posted by FryguyRichmond, VARichmond, Viriginia has been this state\'s capital for many years. During the Civil War, it served as the capital for the Conferacy, and it was close to the Union\'s capital, Washington, D.C. Eventually, the Confederacy was forced to surrender to the Union at Appomattox Court House in Richmond.

properties.name: The White House
properties.description: Posted by FryguyWashington, D.C.The White House is widely known about throughout the world. The President of the United States and his family live here, and some of his closest advisers stay here as well. One unuasal fact about the White House was that it was the not the first place for the President to live. The first few Presidents lived in Philadelphia, but eventually the capital city relocated to Washington, D.C.
